Sequence Information.Peptide Name: eCATH-2 (eCATH2; natural AMPs; equine cathelicidin 2, mammals, animals; horsy; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: present in uncleaved forms in horse neutrophils.Activity: active against a broad range of bacteria E. coli ATCC 25922 or ML 35 (MIC 14 ug/ml), S. marcescens ATCC 8100 (MIC 28.5 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 or SK1 (MIC 28.5 ug/ml or 114 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or MRSA (MIC 57-114 ug/ml),  S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 28.5 ug/ml),  and B. megaterium Bm11 (MIC 14 ug/ml).Fungi: inactive against fungi various C.neoformans (MIC >114 ug/ml), R.rubra (MIC >114 ug/ml), C.albicans (MIC>114 ug/ml),C.parapsilosis (MIC>114 ug/ml), C.tropicalis (MIC>114 ug/ml), and P.etchellsii (MIC>114 ug/ml) in Sabouraud medium. However, active against  C. neoformans (MIC 21-28.5 ug/ml), R.rubra (MIC 57 ug/ml) in RPMI  (Skerlavaj B et al., 2001).MOA:bacteria:E. coli: membrane permeation.Structure:  helical in 30-45% TFE.In vitro toxicity: 10% human RBC 21% lysis at 314 ug/ml.Updated 7/8/2013.
Literature Information.Author: Scocchi M, Bontempo D, Boscolo S, Tomasinsig L, Giulotto E, Zanetti M1999
Literature Information.Title: Novel cathelicidins in horse leukocytes.
